title: AI Reporting
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg)) +   geom_point() +   labs(title = "Car Weight vs MPG") # Only run if API key is present if (Sys.getenv("OPENAI_API_KEY") != "") {   story <- generate_plot_story(p, provider = "openai")   message(story) }

title: Authors and Citation
text: Matheus User. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: User M (2025). unhcrreports: Automated Humanitarian Reports. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://matheus-hardt.github.io/unhcrreports.
code: @Manual{,   title = {unhcrreports: Automated Humanitarian Reports},   author = {Matheus User},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://matheus-hardt.github.io/unhcrreports}, }

title: Automated Humanitarian Reports
text: [!IMPORTANT] Work Process: package currently active development. plotting functions package based excellent work Edouard Legoupil unhcrdatapackage. unhcrreports R package designed generate automated humanitarian reports using UNHCR data, ggplot2, AI-generated narratives. supports country-level regional reports.

title: Automated Humanitarian Reports
text: can install development version unhcrreports GitHub locally:
code: # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("matheus-hardt/unhcrreports")  # Install from local source devtools::install(".")

title: Automated Humanitarian Reports
text: enable AI-generated narratives, need set API key supported LLM provider. package supports OpenAI, Google Gemini, Anthropic, Ollama. Set API key environment variable. can .Renviron file R session:
code: # For Google Gemini Sys.setenv(GEMINI_API_KEY = "your_api_key_here")  # For OpenAI Sys.setenv(OPENAI_API_KEY = "your_api_key_here")  # For Anthropic Sys.setenv(ANTHROPIC_API_KEY = "your_api_key_here")

title: Automated Humanitarian Reports
text: prefer run local model using Ollama: Install Ollama: Download ollama.com. Pull Model: Open terminal pull model (e.g., qwen2.5:32b llama3). ```bash ollama pull qwen2.5:32b region <- “Americas” year <- 2022

title: Automated Humanitarian Reports
text: quarto_render( input = system.file(“templates”, “region_report.qmd”, package = “unhcrreports”), output_file = paste0(“report_”, gsub(” “,”“, region),”_“, year,”.html”), execute_params = list( region = region, year = year ) ) ```

title: Automated Humanitarian Reports
text: Verification Scripts: Check dev/verify_report.R dev/verify_region_report.R example usage. Tests: Run devtools::test() run test suite.

what: Generate Humanitarian Data Story from ggplot (using ellmer) — generate_plot_story
title: Generate Humanitarian Data Story from ggplot (using ellmer) — generate_plot_story
text: function takes ggplot2 object generates storytelling narrative focused humanitarian insights. uses ellmer package call large language model supported provider.

title: Generate Humanitarian Data Story from ggplot (using ellmer) — generate_plot_story
code: generate_plot_story(plot, max_tokens = 300, provider = NULL, model = NULL)

title: Generate Humanitarian Data Story from ggplot (using ellmer) — generate_plot_story
text: plot ggplot object ggplot2. max_tokens Maximum number tokens (approximate) narrative (default = 300). provider Optional character string specifying provider. Options include: "openai", "gemini", "anthropic", "ollama". NULL, auto-detect environment keys. model Optional character string specifying model name. NULL, default model chosen provider used.

title: Generate Humanitarian Data Story from ggplot (using ellmer) — generate_plot_story
text: character string containing storytelling narrative focused humanitarian data.

title: Generate Humanitarian Data Story from ggplot (using ellmer) — generate_plot_story
code: library(ggplot2) p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg)) +     geom_point() +     labs(title = "Car Weight vs MPG") # Only run if API key is present if (Sys.getenv("OPENAI_API_KEY") != "") {     story <- generate_plot_story(p, provider = "openai")     message(story) }

title: Generate Report Executive Summary — generate_report_summary
text: Aggregates section summaries final executive summary.

title: Generate Report Executive Summary — generate_report_summary
code: generate_report_summary(   section_summaries,   country_name,   year,   provider = NULL,   model = NULL,   max_tokens = 600 )

title: Generate Report Executive Summary — generate_report_summary
text: section_summaries named list character vector section summaries. country_name Name country. year Year report. provider Optional provider. model Optional model. max_tokens Max tokens.

title: Generate Report Executive Summary — generate_report_summary
text: character string containing executive summary.

what: Generate Section Summary from Plot Stories — generate_section_summary
title: Generate Section Summary from Plot Stories — generate_section_summary
text: Aggregates individual plot stories cohesive section summary.

title: Generate Section Summary from Plot Stories — generate_section_summary
code: generate_section_summary(   stories,   section_name,   provider = NULL,   model = NULL,   max_tokens = 400 )

title: Generate Section Summary from Plot Stories — generate_section_summary
text: stories character vector stories generated plots within section. section_name title section (e.g., "Population Overview"). provider Optional provider (openai, gemini, anthropic). Auto-detected NULL. model Optional model name. max_tokens Max tokens summary.

title: Generate Section Summary from Plot Stories — generate_section_summary
text: character string containing section summary.

what: Plotting ratio Refugee/Asylum-seekers vs Migrant within a country — plot_ctr_disp_migrant
title: Plotting ratio Refugee/Asylum-seekers vs Migrant within a country — plot_ctr_disp_migrant
text: chart provides insights relative weight Forced Displacement countries generating type displacement. First, size circle represents number Refugees, Asylum-seekers need International Protection vertical axis represent Share immigrants country relation immigrants within country. higher country axis, people country host country independently reason migrated. horizontal axis displays share migration generated forced displacement within country origin. country right, people country cam Forced Displacement.

title: Create a map with symbol proportional to population data by location within country — plot_ctr_location
code: plot_ctr_location(year, country_asylum_iso3c, pop_type, mapbackground = "osm")

title: Create a map with symbol proportional to population data by location within country — plot_ctr_location
text: year Numeric value year  (instance 2022). data yet available year (aka still mid year reporting stage), automatically fall back previous year country_asylum_iso3c Character value ISO-3 character code Country Asylum pop_type Vector character values. Possible population type (e.g.: REF, IDP, ASY, OIP, OOC, STA) mapbackground can "osm" (default), "stamen-toner" , "stamen-terrain","stamen-watercolor". mapbackground requires API key considered

text: ggplot2 object

title: Display A Chart with Refugee Recognition Rate for nationals from a specific country — plot_ctr_origin_recognition
text: Refugee Recognition Rate divides number asylum-seekers granted Convention refugee status total number accepted (Convention , relevant, complementary protection) rejected cases (aka substantive decision). Total Recognition Rate divides number asylum-seekers granted Convention refugee status / complementary form protection total number accepted (Convention , relevant, complementary protection) rejected cases. Non-substantive decisions , extent possible, excluded calculations. purpose international comparability,  UNHCR uses two recognition rates report nationally calculated rates.
code: See https://www.unhcr.org/4ce531e09.pdf

title: Plot Average processing time from registration to first instance asylum decision — plot_ctr_processing_time
text: ggplot2 object

title: Plot Average processing time from registration to first instance asylum decision — plot_ctr_processing_time
text: Status determination procedures core protection function principle mechanism international protection needs Persons Concern may determined accordance key provisions 1951 Convention 1967 Protocol relating Status Refugees, 1954 Convention relating Status Stateless Persons, relevant regional refugee protection instruments. Status determination procedures therefore central full effective enjoyment universal right seek enjoy asylum specific rights guaranteed instruments. prolonged waiting period status determination procedure important indicator state efficiency, fairness, adaptability integrity hence, overall quality national asylum , depending context, UNHCR Mandate RSD procedure, including timeliness effectiveness overall protection response country. (RBM Outcome Indicator 2.1) - see UNHCR Intranet - Credit Hisham Galal chart initial idea script

title: Plot Chart on Refugee Status Determination — plot_reg_rsd
code: plot_reg_rsd(   year = 2022,   region = "The Americas",   top_n_countries = 10,   measure = "Recognized" ) #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.    plot_reg_rsd(   year = 2022,   region = "The Americas",   top_n_countries = 5,   measure = "ComplementaryProtection" ) #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.    plot_reg_rsd(   year = 2022,   region = "The Americas",   top_n_countries = 10,   measure = "TotalDecided" ) #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.    plot_reg_rsd(   year = 2022,   region = "The Americas",   top_n_countries = 10,   measure = "RefugeeRecognitionRate" ) #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.    plot_reg_rsd(   year = 2022,   region = "The Americas",   top_n_countries = 10,   measure = "TotalRecognitionRate" ) #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.    # plot_reg_rsd(year = 2022, #              region = "Europe", #                         top_n_countries = 10, #                         measure = "Recognized")
